DOC.brief_title: Accuracy of the Pleth Variability Index to Predict Fluid Responsiveness in Liver Transplantation
DOC.detailed_description: The aim of this study is to compare the accuracy of PVI (pleth variability index)with other hemodynamic variability that measured with PÄ°CCO (SVV, PPV, CVP,CI)to predict the response of cardiac index to volume replacement in patients undergoing liver transplantation.
DOC.criteria: Elective living donor liver transplantation, >18 years patients Patients with: Arrhythmia Reduced left ventricular function (EF<40%) Hepatocellular carcinoma Pulmonary hypertension Fulminant liver failure valvular heart disease
